s: ^Mrs. Lee! You have been glittered! Are you okay?
^I'm happy to see you, too. Evidently the kids were too.

Chat1: ^Mrslee?Smiling "We made art today! I will shower before I go home."

s: ^You seem so happy! I love this for you, Mrs. Lee.
^You help parents with the paperwork when they sign their kids up for daycare, right?

Chat2: ^Mrslee?Smiling "Every week, it is something new. I feel happy, too. We work with so many smart, creative little people. They teach me to make art. Always shout "More glitter!" so, we always add more glitter!

s: ^I think you're a very brave woman.
^Can I ask about your experiences with something?

Chat3: ^Mrslee?Smiling "Rashad tells me glitter is an infestation. That it will spread and multiply like something from his movies. I say he needs to make more art. Become one with the sparkle, like Lila says."
^Mrslee?Smiling "I like art days, and I like the days I help in the office. I like it all."

s: ^I want to hear more about the art, but today, I'm here to ask office questions.
^I'm helping a friend replace her immunization records for school.

Suggestion1: ^Mrslee_Day 2_Keep your vaccine records with important paperwork like your passport_Elisa2-1

Suggestion1.#: notification Mrslee_Day 2_Keep your vaccine records with important paperwork like your passport_Elisa2-1

Suggestion1: ^Mrslee?Neutral "Immunization records are very important; I make copies for new students to keep in their records here. Vaccines help keep us safe."
^Mrslee?Neutral "When we moved to America, Dr. Lee and I both need more vaccines. Also, when Eddie travels, some countries require additional ones."

^Mrslee?Neutral "Did you know many records exist on internet now? When I was a girl, it was all paper. When Eddie was born, it was all paper. Now? I get some records, like my COVID vaccine, on my phone!"

s: ^What happens if a parent can't find their children's records?
^How do you find those records online?

Suggestion2: ^Mrslee_Day 2_Your doctor or school should be able to provide you with at least partial records; contact them and ask what the process is for obtaining a copy_Elisa2-2

Suggestion2.#: notification Mrslee_Day 2_Your doctor or school should be able to provide you with at least partial records; contact them and ask what the process is for obtaining a copy_Elisa2-2

Suggestion2: ^Mrslee?Neutral "Sometimes, parents ask their pediatrician. The doctor's office keeps many records. A parent can fill out a form and get copies."
^Mrslee?Neutral "The last school somebody attended might be able to help; everyone submits records to prove that they were vaccinated, and the school might have access to those records.
^Mrslee?Smiling "It might take a phone call or email to find the right person to ask. Sometimes schools even fax the records directly to me here!"
^Mrslee?Neutral "The CDC has resources, too. Look it up on the internet. Students moving in from different places might need to do different steps to get their records."
^Mrslee?Smiling "Different states and different countries use different systems, but we often find help online."

s: ^Mrs. Lee, this is super helpful! Thank you.

Goodbye: ^Mrslee?Smiling "I learn so much helping Lila and the kids. Happy to share."
